attributes.action: Explain what the COVID-19 exit strategy is?
attributes.additional_details: We want the government to disclose what plans are in place, including timescales, that will allow society to return to normality free of lockdowns, tests, vaccinations or restrictions like being unable to travel or attend events. Whilst it is important that the vulnerable are protected we need normality to ensure we have a thriving economy which is the backbone of any society. We want leisure, tourism, hospitality to thrive as the UK does and to be able to go to work and see our families.
attributes.background: So far we have been subjected to lockdowns, testing or vaccines. The government have stated there would be no restrictions for those who are not vaccinated. Therefore, we want to know what strategy is in place for a return to normality free of lockdowns, vaccines or testing?

rejection.details: In July 2020 the Government published "Our plan to rebuild: The UK Government’s COVID-19 recovery strategy. This set out plans for lifting restrictions, and was clear that the only feasible long-term solution lies with a vaccine or drug-based treatment: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/our-plan-to-rebuild-the-uk-governments-covid-19-recovery-strategy/our-plan-to-rebuild-the-uk-governments-covid-19-recovery-strategy
